cards.question: What percentage of the worlds population lives with disabilities?
Where do 80% of persons with disabilities reside?
In most OECD countries, which gender reports higher incidents of disability?
What percentage of children with disabilities in developing countries do not attend school?
What is the global literacy rate for adults with disabilities?
cards.answer: 3% overall, and 1% for women with disabilities

cards.question: Are students with disabilities over- or under-represented in higher education?
What is the unemployment rate among persons with disabilities in some countries?
According to the World Bank, what percentage of the world's poorest people have some form of disability?
How many people globally are visually impaired, and what are the three main causes of blindness?
cards.answer: 285 million; cataract, glaucoma, and age-related macular degeneration

overview.description: Over 1 billion people (15% of world population) live with disabilities, making them the world's largest minority group, 80% of persons with disabilities live in developing countries, Women report higher incidents of disability than men, In countries with life expectancies over 70 years, individuals spend about 8 years (11.5% of lifespan) living with disabilities

90% of children with disabilities in developing countries do not attend school, Global literacy rate for adults with disabilities is 3% overall, Global literacy rate for women with disabilities is 1%, Students with disabilities remain under-represented in higher education

20% of the world's poorest people have some kind of disability, Unemployment among persons with disabilities reaches 80% in some countries, Systemic barriers lead to social exclusion and limited societal participation, Limited access to education, housing, food, water, sanitation, healthcare, and credit
26% overall prevalence rate of adults with disabilities, Approximately 61 million adults have some type of disability

More than 285 million people are visually impaired, 90% of visually impaired people live in developing countries, 80% of visual impairments are curable, Main causes include cataracts (47.9%), glaucoma (12.3%), and age-related macular degeneration (8.7%)

quizQuestions.question: Poor people are more at risk of acquiring a disability due to a lack of which of the following factors? (Select three.)
quizQuestions.explanation: The two-way link between poverty and disability creates a vicious circle. Once this occurs, people face barriers to the education, employment, and public services that can help them escape poverty.

quizQuestions.question: While the World Health Organization estimates that 15% of the world has a disability, the number of people who experience significant difficulties in functioning is
quizQuestions.explanation: According to the World Health Survey around 785 million (15.6%) persons 15 years and older live with a disability, while the Global Burden of Disease estimates a figure of around 975 million (19.4%) persons. Of these, the World Health Survey estimates that 110 million people have very significant difficulties in functioning, while the Global Burden of Disease estimates that 190 million have severe disability

quizQuestions.question: Of the 39 million people in the world that are blind, the vast majority
options: Become blind by the age of 10
quizQuestions.explanation: The prevalence of disability increases with age according to the section on Aging and Disability

quizQuestions.question: According the WHO, cataracts account for half of all cases of blindness in the world. The second leading cause is
quizQuestions.explanation: This disease damages the optic nerve from fluid build up.

quizQuestions.question: While around 15% of people in the world have some type of disability, the percentage of adults in the U.S. with a disability is around
quizQuestions.explanation: 61 million American adults have some type of disability.

quizQuestions.question: According to the United Nations Factsheet on Persons with Disabilities, about 80% of persons with disabilities live in developing countries. Which of the following are other key statistics? (Select three.)
options: In most OECD countries, women report higher incidents of disability than men
Unemployment among the persons with disabilities is as high as 20% in some countries
90% of children with disabilities in developing countries do not attend school
The global literacy rate for adults with disabilities is as low as 3%, and 1% for women with disabilities

quizQuestions.question: People with disabilities make up the world's largest minority group.
quizQuestions.explanation: As people age they are more likely to acquire a disability

quizQuestions.question: Disability accentuates poverty because the systemic institutional, environmental, and attitudinal barriers that people with disabilities encounter in their daily lives result in their entrenched social exclusion and their lack of participation in society. Which further problems are caused by their exclusion? (Select two.)
options: Insufficient access to education, housing, food, water, sanitation, and healthcare
Lack of preparation for and meaningful inclusion in the workforce
quizQuestions.explanation: Exclusion of people with disabilities leads to discrimination, lack of adequate access to basic necessities, and the lack of ability to participate in society and the workforce.

quizQuestions.question: Cataract is an incurable eye disease that account for 51% of cases of blindness in the world.
